label: Input Area
description: This is the area where you should input the tree data.
For any given input kind below, the tree will be generated.
Input will wait for you to complete.
This behavior can be changed using setting "Use Immediate Draw"

label: Json Input
description: You can input a non-array & nested json object to generate a binary tree.
The keys that must include in this object are, "left", "right" and "value".
"value" must be numeric and left and right can be switched between low and high.
Check below example:
"left": null,
"right": null,
"value": 2

label: Array Input
description: You can input a decimal & non-scientific array to generate a binary tree.
The input can be either comma separated or whitespace separated
Check below examples:
or

label: Visual Area
description: This is the area where the tree will be displayed in.
For a given valid input, the output tree will be rendered here.

label: Format Input
description: You can format input using the "Format Input" button.
The input must be valid before you can format the input.

label: Redraw Tree
description: You can redraw the tree using the "Redraw Tree" button.
The input must be valid before you can redraw the tree.

label: Save Output
description: You can save the output using the "Save Output" button.

label: Settings
description: You can change the settings using the "View Settings" button.
If need you can reset your settings using "Reset Settings" button the under"Settings"
(Requires a page reload)

label: Attention
description: * Please note that html canvas API has a max size limit for width, height or area.
* This max size limit may differ from client browser.
* So very large output may or may not work even with small node sizes.
